hero.title: PHRYGIAN WAY
hero.subtitle: Walk Through 3000 Years of History
hero.description: Discover the Ancient Phrygian Way - Turkey's Most Spectacular 506km Trail. Embark on an extraordinary journey through the heart of ancient Anatolia, where mysterious rock-carved monuments and timeless villages bring history alive with every step.

introduction.title: The Phrygian Legacy
paragraphs: The Phrygian Way (Frig Yolu) is one of Turkey's longest and most culturally rich hiking trails, stretching 506 kilometers through the ancient lands of Phrygia. Established in 2013 by a dedicated team of volunteers led by Hüseyin Sarı, this remarkable trail connects the modern provinces of Ankara, Afyonkarahisar, Eskişehir, and Kütahya.

Journey through a landscape that has witnessed over 3,000 years of human civilization, from the mighty Phrygian Kingdom of King Midas to the Byzantine Empire and beyond. The trail passes through 44 traditional villages and 5 towns, offering an authentic glimpse into rural Turkish life unchanged for centuries.

In 2018, the Phrygian Way was recognized as one of Europe's finest cultural routes, receiving acclaim for its outstanding historical preservation, sustainable tourism development, community engagement, and international trail standards. This recognition places the Phrygian Way alongside Europe's most prestigious hiking trails, including the Camino de Santiago and the Via Francigena.

provinces.name: Ankara Province
provinces.title: Starting Point: Gordion (Yassıhöyük)
highlights: Home to King Midas's father's tomb
World's oldest standing wooden building (740 BCE)
Starting point for the 219km eastern route

provinces.name: Eskişehir Province
provinces.title: Central Hub: Yazılıkaya (Midas City)
highlights: Convergence point of all three routes

provinces.name: Afyonkarahisar Province
provinces.title: Starting Point: Seydiler
highlights: Natural hot springs used since Phrygian times

route.subtitle: 506 km historic trail through ancient Anatolia
route.description: The Phrygian Way consists of three main routes that converge at the sacred site of Yazılıkaya. The trail is marked according to international standards with red and white blazes, featuring 109 directional poles and 217 signs.

mainRoutes.name: Eastern Route (Gordion)
mainRoutes.description: The longest and most historically rich path, starting from the ancient capital.

mainRoutes.name: Southern Route (Seydiler)
mainRoutes.description: Perfect for beginners, featuring fairy chimneys and thermal springs.

mainRoutes.name: Western Route (Yenice)
mainRoutes.description: The most scenic route through valleys and ancient roads.

services.title: Accommodation
services.description: Village guesthouses offer basic rooms with breakfast. Wild camping is permitted in designated areas. Hotels available in major towns like Sivrihisar and Afyon.

services.title: Food & Water
services.description: Villages have basic shops with bread, cheese, and local products. Springs marked on trail. Carry 3-4 liters capacity in summer. Local specialties include Afyon kaymak and sucuk.

services.title: Trail Marking
services.description: Complete trail marking with red & white stripes (main trail), yellow arrows (alternatives), blue markers (water sources), and green signs (points of interest).

services.title: GPS Navigation
services.description: GPX files available for download. Offline maps compatible with Maps.me and OsmAnd. Coordinates for all major waypoints and emergency contact points marked.

seasons.name: Winter (December-February)
seasons.cons: Snow possible above 1,000m, many facilities closed

categories.title: Navigation & Safety
items: GPS device or smartphone with offline maps

culturalTips: Accept tea when offered (it's rude to refuse)
Respect prayer times in religious areas
Learn basic Turkish phrases (Merhaba, Teşekkür ederim, Su, Yemek)
